p:
For our sample sequence ATGAACACTC, the descriptor, vector V
a , can be defined as:
\documentclass[12pt]{minimal} \usepackage{amsmath} \usepackage{wasysym} \usepackage{amsfonts} \usepackage{amssymb} \usepackage{amsbsy} \usepackage{mathrsfs} \usepackage{upgreek} \setlength{\oddsidemargin}{-69pt} \begin{document} $$ {V}_a=\left(0,1,0,0,4,0,0,0,8,0,0,11,12,0,0,0,0,17,0,0,0,0\right), $$ \end{document}
V a
=
0 1 0 0 4 0 0 0 8 0 0 11 12 0 0 0 0 17 0 0 0 0
,
whereas, for another sequence, ATGGTGCACC, the descriptor, V
b , is:
\documentclass[12pt]{minimal} \usepackage{amsmath} \usepackage{wasysym} \usepackage{amsfonts} \usepackage{amssymb} \usepackage{amsbsy} \usepackage{mathrsfs} \usepackage{upgreek} \setlength{\oddsidemargin}{-69pt} \begin{document} $$ {V}_b=\left(0,1,2,0,0,0,6,0,0,9,0,11,0,0,0,0,0,17,18,0,20\right) $$ \end{document}
V b
=
0 1 2 0 0 0 6 0 0 9 0 11 0 0 0 0 0 17 18 0 20
The distance can then be computed as:
\documentclass[12pt]{minimal} \usepackage{amsmath} \usepackage{wasysym} \usepackage{amsfonts} \usepackage{amssymb} \usepackage{amsbsy} \usepackage{mathrsfs} \usepackage{upgreek} \setlength{\oddsidemargin}{-69pt} \begin{document} $$ D\left({V}_a,{V}_b\right)=0.26995 $$ \end{document}
D
V a
V b
= 0.26995
